meanings.definition: A drug that calms or sedates a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian administered a tranquilizer to the nervous dog before the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The tranquilizer helped the patient relax before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The tranquilizer made the squirrel so calm that it fell asleep in the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice acted like a tranquilizer on his anxious mind.
meanings.sent5: The tranquilizer worked like magic, easing the tension in the room.

meanings.definition: Something that has a calming or sedative effect.
meanings.sent1: The soft music played in the background acted as a tranquilizer for the stressed-out students.
meanings.sent2: The sound of rain has a tranquilizer effect on her, helping her sleep peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies was a tranquilizer for his frazzled nerves.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a tranquilizer, instantly calming everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The view of the sunset over the ocean was a tranquilizer for his troubled mind.
